flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: I got tired of always tripping over cords dangling from a wall socket or trying to separate one cord from a tangled mess in a drawer every time I charged my phone ( other devices). My solution was The Charge Box, a simple circuit with four separate AC circuits that allow for charging up to four devices simultaneously. The sockets and wires are all neatly tucked in the box with only the device connection showing. Each circuit is independently controlled by a toggle switch, so no current is drawn unless a device is being charged. A lighted master switch controls all circuits and provides a visual indication when power is applied t the box.

lines.text: Construction Hint  Since the size of the Charge Box is arbitrary, match measurements of your actual parts rather than using nominal sizes.  My aluminum sheet is a hair under 10” x 4”, which sets the actual dimensions of the other pieces.  The better you match pieces, the more professional the final piece.  Round corners.  Use  sand paper or a small file to remove burrs and give a smooth finish.
